title: BTS are releasing a new version of Make It Right featuring Lauv
text:
The boys are back in town (Picture: @lauvsongs/ Twitter)

Steady yourselves BTS Army, for the Bangtan Boys are releasing a collaboration with Lauv tomorrow.

Big Hit Entertainment tweeted a teaser image of the single Make It Right featuring the I Like Me Better singer.

The announcement came after Lauv, 25, tweeted a picture of himself and BTS on 16 October, along with the caption: ‘Did I finally #makeitright?’

Yes, yes you did, Lauv.

Make It Right was originally released back in April of this year as part of the boys’ Map of the Soul: Persona extended play.

It deservedly entered Billboard’s Hot 100 chart at #95 and Ed Sheeran even helped compose the track.

BTS have recently bounced back hard after returning from their extended period of rest and relaxation, huh.

This single will be the group’s fifth collaboration this year alone, following their hit songs with Zara Larsson, Charli XCX, Juice WRLD, and the UK Top 20 single Boy With Luv featuring the one and only Halsey.

Big Hit Entertainment released a poster confirming the collab (Picture: Twitter/@BigHitEnt)

The Army are a loyal and dedicated fan base, having celebrated lead vocalist Jimin’s 24th birthday with a good deed.

Advertisement

Advertisement

At least 600 fans donated blood in honour of the singer.

According to All K-Pop, the Army started going to blood drives in their droves in the month leading up to the singer’s birthday on 13 October.

More than 710 fans visited the Central Seoul Blood Bank, Busan Blood Bank and Southwest Seoul Blood Bank over the last month, but almost 100 were turned away for not meeting the qualifications to donate blood.

But this final number doesn’t include the many fans all over the world who donated blood but were not counted in this South Korean tally.

Fans also reportedly donated around 2,000 gifts to doctors on behalf of Jimin.

Mad respect.

We know we’re going to lauv the song already (Picture: Instagram/@lauvsongs)

The South Korean Red Cross then announced they are going to give Jimin an Award of Appreciation for inspiring his fans to donate to a charitable cause.

If all fans were like the BTS Army, we could end any global crisis that comes our way.

Make It Right will be released at 6 pm KST (Korea), which is 10 am BST.
